answers.answer: Sorry there is no answer to your question.  The symptoms differ alot from one person to another. The is no test or way to determine in advance what the outcome will be.  Some people live their whole life with mild or no symptoms where as others will develope a host of symptoms.  I have never heard of falling as a symptom of hep c.Ron
I would not say there is no answer to your question.  It depends on how sick your brother is.  If he is in late liver disease he will need lots of care.  How sick is he?

Some people have the flu like symptoms on treatment. The more water he drinks the better for him.When I was about 25 weeks into treatment I started walking very slowly because of my hemoglobin going down. But then I took Procrit. It takes awhile to work.I think NYgirl said she fell a couple of times in the shower while on treatment but I didn't. I prefer a bath. How old is your brother. What stage is his liver disease. What genotype?  It's very important to take fat with the ribavarin. I had 8 or 9 almonds after breakfast then my pills. And ice cream after dinner with my pills. Helps you digest them better and avoid nausea.

Actually I passed out from the low hemo - just passed dead away a few times (prior to that had never happened before).I agree with Grandma and would take my pills with some form of nuts - even peanut butter toast with a yogurt smoothie (things I never ate before but they worked).Unfortunately nothing can tell you what will or won't happen during treatment but we can give you a good list of MIGHTS.  Just remember because we talk about it doesn't mean it will necessarily happen to him...it's just what some of us have gone through.Treatment isn't fun in any way but it's NOT the hardest thing in the world.  I did 72 week while working and being a single mom. I was worn out every single minute but..was able to do it.If I could do that - your brother can do it certainly with you to help him.He's very lucky to have someone as caring as you.  THAT is a HUGE advantage!  He might get what we call 'riba-rage' from the pills...they make you just snap and get mad over NOTHING (but then it goes away) but if it happens................it's not you.  A good doctor should explain all of this to you but if you have more questions you just let us know and we'll try and help.
Thanks for taking time to respond.  His neurological system seems to be having problems and his balance is off a lot.  He falls asleep nearly as soon as he sits down.Thanks again

He is no longer on treatment but still feels much of the time as if he has the flu.  He is nauseated a good deal of the time but his balance is very poor.Thanks for sharing some more info and taking time to respond

He is very ill.  I have not been able to do much with the computer as I have been finding a place that can give him the care he needs.  He is going to move in to the place tomorrow and Hospice Life Path is going to follow him.

Thanks for the tips.  He likes buttermilk and drinks a great deal of it as he says it calms his stomach.Yes, he does have problems with temper flares but soon after the incident he comes and tries to explain what happened to him.  It is very difficult for him as well as those around him.He has lost a GREAT deal of weight over the last 3-4 months as his appetite has been going down.He still craves Pepsie and Coke which does not help the diabetes problem.

Please have your brother's diabetes cared for.  Most of his symptoms sound like the highs and lows of hyper- and hypoglycemia, which is what happens with untreated diabetes.  You need to get an endocrinologist for him, and of course - get him off the Pepsi and Coke.  If he doesn't like diet sodas, water can be delicious - we just have forgotten how refreshing it is.

I have fallen over like and passed out more than once.  I have terrible balace issues.  He is lucky to have you.  I am sorry it has reached a point he has to be removed from home.  I hope you are a pain in the neck to everyone there in a kind way, they know the difference from someone who is just waiting and someone who really cares.  The diabetes is a real red flag with this virus.  circulatory issues and keeping his sugar as close to normal as possible.  The buttermilk....wow not so sure about that, but it is not my place to give any detailed advice.  Good luckRegardsLanier
